description:
This resource provides the Vlan resource in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Core service.

Creates a VLAN in the specified VCN and the specified compartment.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

AvailabilityDomain.description: The availability domain of the VLAN.  Example: `Uocm:PHX-AD-1`.

CidrBlock.description: (Updatable) The range of IPv4 addresses that will be used for layer 3 communication with hosts outside the VLAN. The CIDR must maintain the following rules -.

CompartmentId.description: (Updatable) The OCID of the compartment to contain the VLAN.

DefinedTags.description: (Updatable) Defined tags for this resource. Each key is predefined and scoped to a namespace. For more information, see [Resource Tags](https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/Content/General/Concepts/resourcetags.htm).  Example: `{"Operations.CostCenter": "42"}`.

DisplayName.description: (Updatable) A descriptive name. Does not have to be unique, and it's changeable. Avoid entering confidential information.

FreeformTags.description: (Updatable) Free-form tags for this resource. Each tag is a simple key-value pair with no predefined name, type, or namespace. For more information, see [Resource Tags](https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/Content/General/Concepts/resourcetags.htm).  Example: `{"Department": "Finance"}`.

NsgIds.description: (Updatable) A list of the OCIDs of the network security groups (NSGs) to add all VNICs in the VLAN to. For more information about NSGs, see [NetworkSecurityGroup](https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/api/#/en/iaas/latest/NetworkSecurityGroup/).

RouteTableId.description: (Updatable) The OCID of the route table the VLAN will use. If you don't provide a value, the VLAN uses the VCN's default route table.

VcnId.description: The OCID of the VCN to contain the VLAN.

VlanTag.description: The IEEE 802.1Q VLAN tag for this VLAN. The value must be unique across all VLANs in the VCN. If you don't provide a value, Oracle assigns one. You cannot change the value later. VLAN tag 0 is reserved for use by Oracle.
